meanings.definition: To break up, turn over, or cultivate (soil) with a rototiller.
meanings.sent1: Dad will rototill the garden to prepare it for planting.
meanings.sent2: I need to rototill the backyard before we can sow the seeds.
meanings.sent3: The farmer decided to rototill the field under the full moon for good luck.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas seemed to rototill through the stagnant thoughts in the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The loud roar of the rototiller echoed through the quiet countryside.

meanings.sent1: The rototill in the shed needs some maintenance before spring.
meanings.sent2: We rented a powerful rototill for our community garden project.
meanings.sent3: The old rototill in Grandpa's barn has seen many seasons of use.
meanings.sent4: The rototill hummed to life as the farmer started the engine.
meanings.sent5: The shiny new rototill gleamed in the sunlight, ready for action.
